headline: Hustle The Maroon
subhead: Join a special community of journalists, businessmen, designers, and engineers.

sections.text: Founded in 1892, *The Maroon* is the University of Chicago’s oldest student organization and its most-read student publication—it isn’t even close. We’ve offered a transformative experience for generations of staff, training them in business, journalism, law, and engineering. Our alums have won Pulitzer Prizes, uncovered scandals that have defined presidential administrations, founded successful and influential companies, and even been appointed to the Supreme Court. Today we’re the University of Chicago’s premier student organization. Our journalism is read by millions of people every year. The stories our 150-member staff break have been featured in national publications like the *Washington Post,* the *Wall Street Journal,* and *The Economist,* to name a few. We also manage Marketplace, an online buy-sell platform used by ~10,000 people in Hyde Park and beyond.

sections.text: Our operations are expensive, and since we’re 100% financially independent from the University of Chicago, our business–minded staff—who often later go on to work at top firms in consulting and finance—are challenged to find innovative ways to monetize our various platforms. If you want to learn new skills or master existing ones, see your work have real-world impact, or just have fun and make cool friends in a close-knit environment, come hustle! Oh, and one last thing: when you’re here, you’re family.

As one of the largest organizations on campus, we have positions open for students with all backgrounds and interests. We recruit reporters, arts and sports writers, columnists, photographers, videographers, podcast producers, designers, artists, business members, data specialists, web designers—you name it.
